intro: Psychotria calva var. talbotii, commonly known as the Talbot's Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The plant contains various alkaloids, which have been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological studies.
